description: From Spanish cuarterón (“¾ white, a child of a European and a mestizo”), from cuarto (“one-fourth”) + -on (“-oon: forming related nouns”), from Latin quartus (“one-fourth”). Doublet of cuarteron.

entries.meaning: (dated, chiefly historical) Of or related to quadroons.
examples: Before them, with her face upraised,In timid attitude,Like one half curious, half amazed,A Quadroon maiden stood.

entries.meaning: (dated, chiefly historical) A person considered three-fourths white, having one non-white grandparent.
examples: Diana was a black quadroon, her father being a blackfellow.He was the father of four quadroons who were regarded as half-castes because the lighter part of their mother's blood was Asiatic, and he was only too well aware of what their future would be should he desert them.
